instruction: What spectral feature processing methods were used on quantifying the impact of water and nitrogen deficit stress on plant physiology in soilless tomato crops?
Output: The spectral feature processing methods used were the Modified soil-adjusted vegetation index (MSAVI), Modified red normalized vegetation index (mrNDVI), and Photochemical Reflectance Index (PRI).

instruction: What metric was chosen to determine water and nitrogen deficit stress, and how accurate were the classification results go?
Output:
The metric chosen to determine water and nitrogen deficit stress in the study was a combination of three metrics: MSAVI (Modified Soil Adjusted Vegetation Index), mrNDVI (modified red-edge Normalized Difference Vegetation Index), and PRI (Photochemical Reflectance Index). 

The classification results for the training and testing samples were found to be 89.6% and 91.4% accurate, respectively.

instruction: How did the researchers integrate crop physiology management systems into real artificial intelligence systems using machine learning and hyperspectral sensor data?
Output: The researchers integrated crop physiology management systems into real artificial intelligence systems by performing machine learning with hyperspectral sensor data. They used the Classification Tree model to group complex hyperspectral datasets and provide remote visual results about plant water and nitrogen deficit stress. The model was trained using 75% of the total sample dataset, while the remaining 25% of the data were used to validate the model. By analyzing the combination of MSAVI, mrNDVI, and PRI, the researchers were able to determine water and nitrogen deficit stress with 89.6% and 91.4% classification accuracy values for the training and testing samples, respectively. This integration of machine learning and hyperspectral sensor data allows for richer recommendations and insights into implementing appropriate irrigation and environment control management strategies in sustainable greenhouse production.

instruction: Can the combination of MSAVI, mrNDVI, and PRI be considered as a superior spectroscopic method compared to traditional methods for determining water and nitrogen deficit stress in soilless tomato crops?
